definition: to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: Please accept last night' s dinner with our compliments .
sentences.chinese: 昨天的晚餐就算我们的敬赠，请接受。

sentences.english: A box of chocolates is left with the compliments of the management .
sentences.chinese: 管理人员敬赠了一盒巧克力。

sentences.english: A box of chocolates is leave with the compliments of the management.
sentences.chinese: 管理人员敬赠了一盒巧克力。

definition: to respectfully inform (used at the beginning or end of letters)
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
to create a work of calligraphy for display in a prominent place (typically, a sign)
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
yours truly/yours sincerely (at the end of a letter)
inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc
